snippet: Six months after joining News Corporation to lead a push into the education market, Joel I. Klein became Rupert Murdoch’s legal compass in the phone-hacking scandal.
abstract: Joel I Klein's involvement in helping News Corporation confront the phone-hacking scandal is delaying his own ambitions for improving the company's efforts in education; Klein faces criticism for his seemingly contradictory roles within News Corporation, both investigating wrongdoing inside the company and advising Rupert Murdoch on handling public relations and his appearances before the British Parliament. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: Last week, after a British parliamentary report declared that Rupert Murdoch was ''not a fit person'' to lead a major corporation, several senior News Corporation executives huddled in tense discussion on the eighth floor of the company's New York headquarters. Some initially wanted to take off the gloves and issue an equally damning condemnation of the report's criticism of their chairman and chief executive.

headline.main: Steering Murdoch in Scandal, Klein Put School Goals Aside
